alert.note: Alert for Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 12 at 12:52PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Arizona, including the following county, Navajo. * WHEN...Until 400 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1251 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Overflowing poor drainage areas will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.25 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Cottonwood Wash, Day Wash, Dodson Wash, Pinedale Wash, Stinson Wash, West Fork Cottonwood Wash, Willow Wash, Jumpoff Canyon, Deer Springs Canyon, Decker Wash and Phoenix Park Wash. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Clay Springs and Fort Apache Reservation. - This includes State Route 260 between mile markers 314 and 325. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
